title: Manage RAVE Packages
text: Manages package dependence RAVE project

title: Manage RAVE Packages
text: Please cite following paper publication use: Magnotti, JF, Wang, Z, Beauchamp, MS. RAVE: comprehensive open-source software reproducible analysis visualization intracranial EEG data. NeuroImage, 223, p.117341. (DOI)

title: Install or upgrade 'RAVE' — RAVE-install
text: Installs newest version 'RAVE' dependence packages; executes scripts finalize installation update configuration files.

title: Install or upgrade 'RAVE' — RAVE-install
code: add_shortcuts()  finalize_installation(   packages = NULL,   upgrade = c("config-only", "ask", "always", "never", "data-only"),   async = FALSE,   ... )  clear_cache()  install(   allow_cache = FALSE,   upgrade_manager = FALSE,   finalize = TRUE,   force = FALSE,   python = FALSE,   migrate_packages = FALSE,   lib_path = NA,   ... )  update_rave(   allow_cache = FALSE,   upgrade_manager = FALSE,   finalize = TRUE,   force = FALSE,   python = FALSE,   migrate_packages = FALSE,   lib_path = NA,   ... )  upgrade_installer(reload = TRUE)

title: Install or upgrade 'RAVE' — RAVE-install
text: packages packages run finalizing installation scripts upgrade upgrade type async whether execute finalizing installation scripts processes ... passed internal functions allow_cache whether allow cache; default true upgrade_manager whether upgrade installer (ravemanager) updating packages finalize whether run finalizing installation scripts force whether force updating packages even installed latest versions python whether install python; default false migrate_packages whether migrate (copy) packages installed system path user library; used alternative option existing packages installed system library path hard resolve -dated; default FALSE lib_path library path 'RAVE' installed; default automatically determined. reload whether reload ravemanager installation; default true. tries load upgraded ravemanager without restarting R session; however, solution always works. case, restarting R session always solution.

title: Install or upgrade 'RAVE' — RAVE-install
text: Nothing

title: Install & Configure 'python' environment for 'RAVE' — configure-python
text: Installs 'python' environment 'RAVE'

title: Install & Configure 'python' environment for 'RAVE' — configure-python
code: validate_python(verbose = TRUE, env_name = NA)  configure_python(python_ver = "3.11", verbose = TRUE)  remove_conda(ask = TRUE)  ensure_rpymat(env_name = NA)

title: Install & Configure 'python' environment for 'RAVE' — configure-python
text: verbose whether verbose messages env_name 'conda' environment use; set NA verify default environment python_ver python version; default automatically determined. specific python version needed, please specify explicitly, example, python_ver='3.8' ask whether ask resetting 'python' environment

title: Install & Configure 'python' environment for 'RAVE' — configure-python
text: Use ravemanager::configure_python() install configure python environment using miniconda. conda binary environment completely isolated. means installation safe affect existing configurations computer. isolated environment, following packages installed: numpy, scipy, pandas, h5py, jupyterlab, pynwb, mat73, mne. can always add conda packages via rpymat::add_packages(...) pip packages via rpymat::add_packages(..., pip = TRUE). use 'python' environment, please run rpymat::ensure_rpymat() activate current session. running via 'RStudio', open 'python' script use 'ctrl/cmd+enter' run line--line. switch R python mode, using command rpymat::repl_python() jupyterlab automatically installed configuration. launch jupyterlab, use rpymat::jupyter_launch() want remove conda environment, use R command rpymat::remove_conda(). procedure absolutely safe affect installations.

title: Install & Configure 'python' environment for 'RAVE' — configure-python
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # -------- Install & Configure python environment for RAVE -------- ravemanager::configure_python()  # Add conda packages rpymat::add_packages("numpy")  # Add pip packages rpymat::add_packages("nipy", pip = TRUE)  # -------- Activate RAVE-python environment -------- rpymat::ensure_rpymat()  # run script from a temporary file f <- tempfile(fileext = ".py") writeLines(c(   "import numpy",   "print(f'numpy installed: {numpy.__version__}')" ), f) rpymat::run_script(f)  # run terminal command within the environment rpymat::run_command("pip list")  # run python interactively, remember to use `exit` to exit # python mode rpymat::repl_python()    } # }

title: Print 'RAVE' debugging information — debug_info
text: function generate report. Please include report file issue. Useful reporting issues 'RAVE' developers.

title: Print 'RAVE' debugging information — debug_info
text: max_lines maximum number log entries print

title: Print out 'RAVE' session log — export_logs
text: Print 'RAVE' session log

title: Print out 'RAVE' session log — export_logs
code: export_logs(   session = NULL,   modules = NULL,   max_lines = Sys.getenv("RAVEMANAGER_BUGREPORT_MAX", "200"),   verbose = TRUE )

title: Print out 'RAVE' session log — export_logs
text: session 'RAVE' session string; default recent (active) session modules module read; default max_lines maximum number lines read; default 200 verbose whether print log; default true

title: Print out 'RAVE' session log — export_logs
text: characters log

what: Find packages with empty files — find_packages_with_empty_files
title: Find packages with empty files — find_packages_with_empty_files
text: Check whether packages installed correctly. rare cases (possibly network issues), packages downloaded contain empty files. function provides method check empty files packages.

title: Find packages with empty files — find_packages_with_empty_files
Find packages with empty files — find_packages_with_empty_files
text: lib library path packages installed; default set user library path.

title: Find packages with empty files — find_packages_with_empty_files
text: list packages (files) containing empty files.

title: Find packages with empty files — find_packages_with_empty_files
code: find_packages_with_empty_files() #> The following packages have empty files:  #> renv            - [1%] 1 empty of 75 files #> pkgdown         - [1%] 2 empty of 161 files #> Rcpp            - [0%] 1 empty of 657 files #>  #> If you suspect that any package was installed incorrectly, please use #> 	ravemanager::add_r_package('<pkg_name>') #> to re-install.

what: Install/Update R or Python packages to RAVE environment — install_packages
title: Install/Update R or Python packages to RAVE environment — install_packages
text: Install/Update R Python packages RAVE environment

title: Install/Update R or Python packages to RAVE environment — install_packages
code: add_r_package(   pkg,   lib = get_libpaths(check = TRUE),   repos = get_mirror(),   type = getOption("pkgType"),   ...,   INSTALL_opts = "--no-lock" )  add_py_package(pkg, method = c("pip", "conda"))

title: Install/Update R or Python packages to RAVE environment — install_packages
text: pkg name package repos, lib, type, INSTALL_opts, ... internally used method whether use 'pip' 'conda'; default 'pip'

title: Install/Update R or Python packages to RAVE environment — install_packages
text: Nothing

title: Install/Update R or Python packages to RAVE environment — install_packages
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # ---- R -------------------------------------------------------- # Install R packages (CRAN, BioC, or RAVE's repository) add_r_package("ravebuiltins") add_r_package("rhdf5")  # Install from Github (github.com/dipterix/threeBrain) add_r_package("dipterix/threeBrain")  # Install Github branch add_r_package("dipterix/threeBrain@custom-electrode-geom")  # ---- Python ----------------------------------------------------  # Normal pypi packages add_py_package("threebrainpy")  # Add through conda add_py_package("fftw", method = "conda")   } # }

title: Get system requirements for 'RAVE' — system_requirements
text: Get system requirements 'RAVE'

title: Get system requirements for 'RAVE' — system_requirements
code: system_requirements(   os = NULL,   os_release = NULL,   curl = Sys.which("curl"),   sudo = FALSE,   ... )

title: Get system requirements for 'RAVE' — system_requirements
text: os, os_release operating system release version, currently supports 'ubuntu', 'centos', 'redhat', 'opensuse', 'sle'; see https://github.com/rstudio/r-system-requirements#operating-systems curl location curl binary system sudo whether pre-pend 'sudo' commands ... reserved future use

title: Get system requirements for 'RAVE' — system_requirements
code: if("remotes" %in% loadedNamespaces()) { # Please check your operating system & version!!!  # =============== On Ubuntu Linux ===============  # Ubuntu 20 ravemanager::system_requirements("ubuntu", "20")  # Ubuntu 18 ravemanager::system_requirements("ubuntu", "18")  # Ubuntu 16 ravemanager::system_requirements("ubuntu", "16")  # =============== On Red Hat Enterprise Linux ===============  # Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 ravemanager::system_requirements("redhat", "8")  # Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 ravemanager::system_requirements("redhat", "7")  # =============== On CentOS ===============  # Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 ravemanager::system_requirements("centos", "8")  # Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 ravemanager::system_requirements("centos", "7")  # =============== On OpenSUSE ===============  # openSUSE 42.3 ravemanager::system_requirements("opensuse", "42")  # =============== On SUSE Linux Enterprise ===============  # SUSE Linux Enterprise 12.3 ravemanager::system_requirements("sle", "12")  }

title: Uninstall RAVE components — uninstall
text: Remove cache, python, /settings. Please aware R, 'RStudio', already installed R packages uninstalled. Please carefully read printed messages.

title: Uninstall RAVE components — uninstall
text: components component remove, see example choices.

title: Uninstall RAVE components — uninstall
code: if( FALSE ) {    # remove cache only   ravemanager::uninstall("cache")    # remove python environment   ravemanager::uninstall("python")    # remove all sample data, settings files   ravemanager::uninstall("all")  }
